addressleaf.section: To the right honorable my very singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

16 Julij
1592.
M
r
Bodeleie to my L./.

page.lettertext:
fol.109r
May it please yo
r
good L. to prevent
e misca-
rieng, or
e slowe deliverie of my last, I have
sent
e transcript of it heere: and an other of
that letter, w
ch
I writte unto yo
r
L.
e 21 of A
p
wherein yow were advertised, what was offered
by
e
states,
to
e aide of
e
Kinge
in
Britaine.
I have nowe proposed it a freshe, and am promi-
sed an answear. But for ought I can perceave,
their answear will be made but in generall
termes (for so I am informed in secret confe-
rence w
t
my frindes) and w
t
out any mention
of any of those pointes,
at were contened in their
offer, and in my forsaid letter. For it was no
perfitte resolution, w
ch
they tooke at that time,
but a certaine project of their owne, w
ch
they were
purposed then to propose unto
e Provinces, if her
Ma
tie
would be willing to make an offer of her
assistance, in
at kinde of proportion, as they had
made
e motion. But yet to signifie so muche
by their publicke letters to her Ma
tie
they said
at
at time,
at they might not, nor will not nowe
undoubtedly, lest
e Provinces should impute it
for presumption unto them, to prejudice their
consentes by making former promises. Never-
theles I am privatly assured by some of their
assembly,
at if her Hig
nes
will be pleased, to signi-
fie to me, howe farre she will assent to their for-
said offer, to
e end they may be sure wherupon
they may grownde, they will presently proceede,
to persuading w
t
e Provinces.
And thus atten-
ding every houre
e answear of
e states, w
ch
I will
presently send unto yo
w
, I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. July 16 1592.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
